subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... This is not always true. You can use interpretation just to speed up things. Check projects like HP dynamo or the sun hotspot itself. Of course typical
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:
>
>
> Yes, to a degree. However, C++ deals with much of this at compile time.
> Think template metaprogramming. Typical benchmarks show C++ running at
> 97% or so of the speed of C. As you add interpretation, the speed goes
> down.

This is not always true. You can use interpretation just to speed up things.
Check projects like HP dynamo or the sun hotspot itself.

Of course typical high level languages interpreters are slow, but
dynamic low level interpreters (native binaries/bytecode) are different.


Bye


Lorenzo
